metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3177 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Python 3.x through 3.9.1 has a buffer overflow in PyCArg_repr in_ctypes/callproc.c, which may lead to remote code execution in certainPython applications that accept floating-point numbers as untrusted input,as demonstrated by a 1e300 argument to c_double.from_param. This occursbecause sprintf is used unsafely.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3177` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python2.7 - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1.6
libpython2.7 - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1.6
libpython2.7-minimal - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1.6
libpython2.7-stdlib - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1.6
libpython2.7-testsuite - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1.6
python2.7 - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1.6
python2.7-examples - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1.6
python2.7-minimal - 2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1.6
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

idle-python3.6 - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.4
libpython3.6 - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.4
libpython3.6-minimal - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.4

python3.6-minimal - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.4
python3.6-venv - 3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

idle-python3.7 - 3.7.5-2~18.04.4
libpython3.7 - 3.7.5-2~18.04.4
libpython3.7-minimal - 3.7.5-2~18.04.4
libpython3.7-stdlib - 3.7.5-2~18.04.4

No subscription required

idle-python3.8 - 3.8.0-3~18.04.1

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.7.17-1~18.04ubuntu1.6').
python3.6 package in esm-infra/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.6.9-1~18.04ubuntu1.4').
python3.7 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.7.5-2~18.04.4').
python3.8 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.8.0-3~18.04.1').
